intro: Coreopsis trichosperma, commonly known as the tickseed coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring upright stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with yellow petals surrounding a dark brown central disk, which bloom from late spring to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Coreopsis trichosperma is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
